Class Matrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • Matrix
  • public class Matrix
extends java.lang.Object
    The Matrix class allows to do several operations with matrices.
    Version:
    28/11/2022
    Author:
    Paula Díaz Álvarez

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static java.lang.String ERROR_NOT_SQUARED
      Error message that will be thrown if the user introduces a matrix that is not squared
      static java.lang.String ERROR_WRONG_COLUMN
      Error message that will be thrown if the user introduces a number for the column that is negative or its higher than the width of the matrix
      static java.lang.String ERROR_WRONG_DIMENSION
      Error message that will be thrown if the user introduces a matrix with dimension greater than 20

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Matrix​(int dimension)
      Constructor for creating a squared matrix of a given dimension filled with random integers between 0 and 255.
      Matrix​(int[][] matrix)
      Constructor for creating a copy of a given matrix.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> flattenMatrix()
      Returns the content of the matrix “flattened” (returns the content of the matrix in one row)
      int[][] getMatrix()
      Returns a copy of the matrix.
      void moveColumn​(int column)
      Move the elements of the given column to the last column of the matrix, moving the rest of the columns one position to the left.
      void print()
      Prints the content of the matrix in a matrix format
      int replaceMatrix​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> flatMatrix)
      Replace as many elements of the matrix as possible with the elements of the flatMatrix
      int[][] smoothMatrix()
      Returns a matrix where each element corresponds with the average of its neighbours (excluding the element itself) of the original matrix
      void swapReveseByDiagonals()
      Interchanges the elements of the two diagonals of the matrix

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Matrix

        public Matrix​(int dimension)
        Constructor for creating a squared matrix of a given dimension filled with random integers between 0 and 255. If the given dimension is negative, equal to 0 or higher than 20, an error message will appear
        Parameters:
        dimension - It's the dimension for the matrix that is going to be created

      • Matrix

        public Matrix​(int[][] matrix)
        Constructor for creating a copy of a given matrix. If the given matrix is not square, an error message will appear. If the dimension of the given matrix is higher than 20, another error message will appear
        Parameters:
        matrix - Corresponds to the given matrix

    • Method Detail

      • getMatrix

        public int[][] getMatrix()
        Returns a copy of the matrix.
        Returns:
        A copy of the matrix

      • flattenMatrix

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> flattenMatrix()
        Returns the content of the matrix “flattened” (returns the content of the matrix in one row)
        Returns:
        The content of the matrix in one row

      • swapReveseByDiagonals

        public void swapReveseByDiagonals()
        Interchanges the elements of the two diagonals of the matrix

      • moveColumn

        public void moveColumn​(int column)
        Move the elements of the given column to the last column of the matrix, moving the rest of the columns one position to the left. If the number of column is not valid, an error message will appear
        Parameters:
        column - It's the number of the column that you want to move

      • print

        public void print()
        Prints the content of the matrix in a matrix format

      • replaceMatrix

        public int replaceMatrix​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> flatMatrix)
        Replace as many elements of the matrix as possible with the elements of the flatMatrix
        Parameters:
        flatMatrix - It's the matrix that replaces the elements of the other one
        Returns:
        The number of elements replaced

      • smoothMatrix

        public int[][] smoothMatrix()
        Returns a matrix where each element corresponds with the average of its neighbours (excluding the element itself) of the original matrix
        Returns:
        The matrix that has as elements the average of the neighbours
